item.title: Checking a system's endianness
item.description: So… what’s endianness? Put simply, the endianness of a machine tells us how that machine’s memory is organised. In order to fully grasp what that means we need to take a small step back and take a look at how we interact with a computer’s memory. Before we begin note we’ll make extensive use of hexadecimal (i.e. hex) numbers. When we’re using them we’ll prefix them with 0x. What was memory again?
